dmca.title: Complaint
dmca.body:
nc 

-----Original Message-----
From: john roberts [mailto:foodconsumer.org@gmail.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, June 14, 2005 3:41 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Complaint

Peter Lu, Ph.D.
Foodconsumer.org
4310 Greenfield Lance
Manitowoc, WI 54220
Ph. 920 686 8408
email: foodconsumer@gmail.com

June 14, 2005

George Poletes, Legal Counsel
thePlanet.com
1333 Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas, TX 75207

RE:  Hosting client of theplanet.com p2preactor.com has repeatedly infringed
copyright of others.

Dear Mr. Poletes:

I am submitting this letter to notify you that one of your hosting clients
p2preactor.com has repeatedly infringed our copyright by copying and
republishing articles published on our website foodconsumer.org to
p2preactor.com web site without our permission. 
I'd like to have your assistance to stop such an illegal activities.

Enclosed please find that 10 web pages, 5 web pages to show you how and what
p2preactor.com published, and other 5 pages to show you the original
webpages we published on foodconsumer.org.

p2preactor.com's copying and republishing has already caused us
foodconsumer.org material loss in our business.  What p2preactor.com does
is, copy and republish our articles and in effect it comes back to compete
with us for the audience at http://www.news.google.com. 
p2preactor.com uses our articles to push down our articles' ranking on
news.google.com, which causes us a big loss of audience and advertising
revenue.

p2preactor.com copies thousands of articles in a single day from hundreds of
news web sites including Reuters.com, USAtoday.com and many other major news
media companies.

Based on what evidence shows, what p2preactor.com is doing is not a single
event or a mistake.  It's a business based on the infringement of others'
copyright.

I, as the publisher of foodconsumer.org, hereby request that your company
theplanet.com take a swift action to block access of others to the illegal
materials in the hosting account for p2preactor.com.  I hope that your
company would not want to knowingly allow your client to use your facility
for any illegal activities.

Please kindly respond.

Sincerely yours,

Peter Lu, Ph.D.
Publisher, foodconsumer.org

Enclosures: 

1) Links to the illegally republished web pages and webpages where original
articles were published.

http://www.p2preactor.com/article3371.html
http://www.foodconsumer.org/777/8/Exercise_helps_breast_cancer_patients_reco
ver_after_chemotherapy.shtml

http://www.p2preactor.com/article3735.html
http://www.foodconsumer.org/777/8/New_case_of_mad_cow_disease_.shtml

http://www.p2preactor.com/article3777.html
http://www.foodconsumer.org/777/8/Hepatitis_A_outbreak_in_Russia.shtml

http://www.p2preactor.com/article5159.html
http://www.foodconsumer.org/777/8/Prostate_cancer_requires_no_immediate_radi
ation_therapy.shtml

http://www.p2preactor.com/article5801.html
http://www.foodconsumer.org/777/8/Telomere_length_suggests_smoking_and_obesi
ty_promote_aging.shtml

2)  Web pages attached.
